result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J. SANDERS

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in.  The defendant plead to a charge of burglary in 14 CF 364.  Motion granted.
Victim Impact Statement.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set to 12-18-14 at 11:00 a.m.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-18-14 at 11:00 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery. 
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-19-14 at 10:15 a.m.  
Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 horus and defendant is to have no contact with Anshe Pole Zedek Synagogue or its premises.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant refused to sign.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.   
Minutes.

RE:  Anshe Pole Zedek Synagogue, on 09-30-14.
Initial appearance is set for 11-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.
